channel.title: Savor Podcast
channel.description: The hosts of Savor, Danielle Beck-Ellsworth, PsyD MFT CEDS and Kelly Hinds RD LD CEDRD explore topics that are related to health, body image, nutrition, and mindfulness. Myths and misconceptions about dieting, obesity, and thinness are questioned and confronted. Dr. Beck-Ellsworth as a therapist and professor and Kelly as a dietitian, bring their years of experience to Savor to debate, discuss and sometimes disagree about the health messages in Western media. For more information about Savor, visit savorpodcast.com
channel.itunes:summary: The hosts of Savor, Danielle Beck-Ellsworth, PsyD MFT CEDS and Kelly Hinds RD explore topics that are related to health, body image, nutrition, and mindfulness. Myths and misconceptions about dieting, obesity, and thinness are questioned and confronted. Dr. Beck-Ellsworth as a therapist and professor and Kelly as a dietitian, bring their years of experience to Savor to debate, discuss and sometimes disagree about the health messages in Western media. For more information about Savor, visit savorpodcast.com

item.title: Do You Want The Good News First?
item.description: OK…Danielle is having a baby girl!! The BIG news…We are saying our final goodbye to Savor Podcast today. All of our episodes will continue to be available to you & your friends … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
OK…Danielle is having a baby girl!!

The BIG news…We are saying our final goodbye to Savor Podcast today. All of our episodes will continue to be available to you & your friends right where you’ve always found them. For at least the next year. We will let you know where to find them if we relocate them after that.

Never fear, if you need us, we are Still Here! For your questions, your comments or to work together. Find us on our respective websites: Danielle & Kelly

We would like to think we are trendsetters because when we birthed Savor, podcasts about intuitive eating, eating disorders, body image & health at every size were nowhere to be found. But if podcasts are your jam & you poke around today, you are going to find them! A couple you might like:

Love, Food Podcast by dietitian, Julie Dillon

Dietitians Unplugged Podcast by dietitian, Aaron Flores

We cannot say enough THANK YOUs for the support you have shown Savor podcast the past three seasons. We are so lucky to have been a part of your lives.
item.itunes:subtitle: OK…Danielle is having a baby girl!! The BIG news…We are saying our final goodbye to Savor Podcast today. All of our episodes will continue to be available to you & your friends … Continue Reading →

Never fear, if you need us, we are Still Here! For your questions, your comments or to work together. Find us on our respective websites: Danielle & Kelly
We would like to think we are trendsetters because when we birthed Savor, podcasts about intuitive eating, eating disorders, body image & health at every size were nowhere to be found. But if podcasts are your jam & you poke around today, you are going to find them! A couple you might like:

We cannot say enough THANK YOUs for the support you have shown Savor podcast the past three seasons. We are so lucky to have been a part of your lives.

item.title: Stress – If It Doesn’t Kill You…
item.description: STRESS – can it make you stronger? It depends… Danielle & Kelly share their experiences with stress and Danielle teaches you how to better cope with it. Quiz Alert! There’s another good … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
STRESS – can it make you stronger? It depends…

Danielle & Kelly share their experiences with stress and Danielle teaches you how to better cope with it.

Quiz Alert! There’s another good one for you today!

For more information on this topic, check out the TED talk mentioned in the episode.

item.title: Thick Dumpling Skin
item.description: Lynn Chen, actor & National Eating Disorders Association Spokesperson, introduces us to her website, Thick Dumpling Skin, dedicated to the Asian-American woman’s quest for the perfect body. Lynn highlights the struggles people have … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
Lynn Chen, actor & National Eating Disorders Association Spokesperson, introduces us to her website, Thick Dumpling Skin, dedicated to the Asian-American woman’s quest for the perfect body. Lynn highlights the struggles people have finding treatment when they don’t fit the “rich, white girl” stereotype of a patient with an eating disorder. She also shares how her online food blog guided her recovery. Lynn is happy to answer questions or be of support to you and can be contacted through her website.

Some resources Lynn thought you might find helpful:

APIOPA

Women Against Negative Talk

A special thanks to Amrie DeFrates for introducing us to Lynn in her Body Image Series!

If you would like to support us with your donations, click this link to share an amount you are comfortable with.

Visit iTunes to subscribe.

item.title: The Invisible Women
item.description: When Dr. Margo Maine speaks, we all listen. We can’t even begin to express the gratitude we have for Dr. Maine sharing her time & expertise with us. One of our … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
When Dr. Margo Maine speaks, we all listen. We can’t even begin to express the gratitude we have for Dr. Maine sharing her time & expertise with us. One of our listeners reached out about her struggle with finding the right fit for treatment as a woman in her 40s. Dr. Maine’s new book, Pursuing Perfection, speaks directly to this problem. For instance, did you know that 13% of adult women over the age of 50 display eating disorder symptoms? In comparison, only 12.4% have breast cancer. You won’t want to miss this episode & definitely want to purchase the book, published by Routledge, when it hits the shelves in June.

If you would like to support us with your donations, click this link to share an amount you are comfortable with.

Visit iTunes to subscribe.

item.title: Your Only Job Is To Relax
item.description: Norah McIntire, L.Ac. graciously shared her time & expertise to explore the world of Chinese Medicine & Acupuncture. Norah practices in Los Angeles, California and you can find more information … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
Norah McIntire, L.Ac. graciously shared her time & expertise to explore the world of Chinese Medicine & Acupuncture. Norah practices in Los Angeles, California and you can find more information about her practice & this topic on her website.

If you would like to read more, Norah suggested these sites:

www.acufinder.com

www.acupuncture.com

www.acupuncturetoday.com

If you have more questions, you can contact Norah at nmcintirelac@yahoo.com.

To receive CEU credit for this episode, submit payment by clicking here, complete this quiz & return to info@savorpodcast.com

item.title: Savor Serves Up Home Cooking
item.description: To celebrate National Nutrition Month, Danielle & Kelly took a detour from the norm and did a cooking demonstration on air! Danielle was the test chef and Kelly talked about ways to … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
To celebrate National Nutrition Month, Danielle & Kelly took a detour from the norm and did a cooking demonstration on air!

Danielle was the test chef and Kelly talked about ways to save money on your grocery bill and eat well.

The Savor Shoutout for our recipes goes to Leanne Brown the author of Good & Cheap cookbook, available for FREE on her website.

For your mouth-watering pleasure…photos of Danielle’s Tilapia & Cornmeal Bread-Crumb-Crusted Vegetables.

 

 

If you would like to support us with your donations, click this link to share an amount you are comfortable with.

Visit iTunes to subscribe.

item.title: It’s Not Your Body, It’s Your Mind!
item.description: To kick off National Eating Disorders Awareness Week, one of our listeners wanted YOU to hear about her journey into RECOVERY. We encourage you to get involved in your community this … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
To kick off National Eating Disorders Awareness Week, one of our listeners wanted YOU to hear about her journey into RECOVERY. We encourage you to get involved in your community this week too. You can find more information about events/activities by visiting the NEDA website.

I have to say that every minute of this interview with Jen Picicci was fun for me, you’re going to love her! Such a Dynamic woman! Thanks Jen!

Jen’s Savor Shoutout goes to the straight-talking Isabel Foxen Duke.

Jen also recommended the book Runaway Eating by Cynthia Bulik, PhD.

If you would like to support us with your donations, click this link to share an amount you are comfortable with.

Visit iTunes to subscribe.

item.title: The Competitive Athlete
item.description: Thank You Melissa Streno, PsyD CC-ASP, for answering our questions on the topic of competitive athletes and eating disorders. Dr. Streno practices at the Eating Disorder Center of Denver. She covers topics such … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
Thank You Melissa Streno, PsyD CC-ASP, for answering our questions on the topic of competitive athletes and eating disorders. Dr. Streno practices at the Eating Disorder Center of Denver.

She covers topics such as:

How much is too much exercise?

What are the warning signs of an athlete struggling with an eating disorder?

Where should athletes turn to seek help?

If you would like to support us with your donations, click this link to share an amount you are comfortable with.

item.title: Continuing Your Education
item.description: We are now offering Continuing Education Units for professionals who need them. Dr. Beck-Ellsworth is a certified provider with the California Board of Behavioral Sciences. In order to receive credits, … Continue Reading →
item.content:encoded:
We are now offering Continuing Education Units for professionals who need them. Dr. Beck-Ellsworth is a certified provider with the California Board of Behavioral Sciences. In order to receive credits, go to the CEU section of our website, choose a lesson, submit payment & your completed quiz. When we have received all of your information, you will receive a Certificate for 1 credit hour.

Check back frequently as more episodes will be made available for credits.

Please contact us if you have questions.
